summary: The Artificial Intelligence Risk Evaluation Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of Energy to establish the Advanced Artificial Intelligence Evaluation Program. This program will test and evaluate advanced AI systems to assess potential risks, including those related to national security, public safety, and civil liberties. The bill defines key terms like "advanced artificial intelligence system" and "adverse AI incident," and requires developers to participate and provide information. It includes penalties for non-compliance and directs the Secretary to submit a plan to Congress for Federal oversight of AI, including potential regulatory frameworks and considerations for artificial superintelligence. The program has a 7-year sunset clause.
